1: 1 is the number of moons orbiting Earth./trivia
2: 2 is the number of polynucleotide strands in a DNA double helix./trivia
3: 3 is the number of notes in a triad, the basic form of any chord./math
5: 5 is the number of basic tastes (sweet, salty, sour, bitter, and umami)./math
7: 7 is the number of main stars in the constellations of the Big Dipper and Orion./date
11: 11 is the approximate periodicity of a sunspot cycle in years./date
13: 13 is the number of unique ranks in a suit in a pack of cards./date
17: 17 is the number of flames emanating from the grenade cap-badge of the Grenadier Guards./date
19: 19 is the final year a person is a teenager./date
23: 23 is the number of chromosomes normal human sex cells have./date
29: 29 is the number of attributes existing according to The Strokes in You Only Live Once./date
31: 31 is the number of flavors of Baskin-Robbins ice cream./date
37: 37 is the normal human body temperature in degrees Celsius./date
41: 41 is the number of soldiers in The Expendables (2010 film) tactor Eric Roberts laments to his subordinates about having been killed by star Sylvester Stallone in his escape from their island./date
43: 43 is the maximum number of cars participating in a NASCAR race in the Cup Series or Nationwide Series./date
47: 47 is the number of phonemes in English phonology in Received Pronunciation./date
53: 53 is the most points by a rookie in a NBA Playoff game (Philadelphia's Wilt Chamberlain, 1960)./year
59: 59 is the number corresponding to the last second in a given minute./year
61: 61 is the code for international direct dial phone calls to Australia./year
67: 67 is the number of throws in Judo./year
71: 71 is the number of different characters that can be used with a standard English Keyboard, excluding uppercase letters./year
79: 79 is the record for cumulative weeks at #1 on the Billboard charts, held by Elvis Presley./year
83: 83 is the atomic number of bismuth./year
89: 89 is the atomic number of actinium./year
97: 97 is the number of leap days that the Gregorian calendar contains in its cycle of 400 years./year
